http://www.moccw.org/map.html
 
 Will the streets run red with blood?
 Will people start to shoot each other over minor disputes?
 Will people become infected with criminal intent?
 
 Hmmmm. No.
 
 Florida was the first the issue CCW. None of the above happened.

post_info.post_title: Missouri is now a CCW state.

Crime will go down, just like in all of the other states that put in place a CCW program.

Crime will go down, just like in all of the other states that put in place a CCW program.

 
 States which don't allow people to carry concealed weapons or have strict concealed carry laws have experienced a bigger drop in violent crime. 
 "Between 1992 through 1998 (the last six years for which data exists), the violent crime rate in the strict and no-issue states fell 30% while the violent crime rate for states that liberalized carry laws prior to 1992 dropped half as much — by 15%. Nationally, the violent crime rate fell 25%."
 http://www.bradycampaign.org/facts/research/conctruth.asp

 "Between 1992 through 1998 (the last six years for which data exists), the violent crime rate in the strict and no-issue states fell 30% while the violent crime rate for states that liberalized carry laws prior to 1992 dropped half as much - by 15%. Nationally, the violent crime rate fell 25%."
 http://www.bradycampaign.org/facts/research/conctruth.asp

 
 
 
 I do not believe it. The sources cited by the pro-freedom movement are footnoted INDEPENDENT studies..
 
 
 Your link states:"An analysis conducted by The Brady Center to Prevent Gun Violence"
 
 
 
 This was biased and faked at best.... Show me..... DC Survey says! XXX Show me.... Baltimore!!!, Survey says! XXX!
 
 
 They don't give links to thier data (pro-freedom sites do), They don't even break it down by state!
 
 
 This whole campaign is based on an emotional response of Brady's wife... Show me... independent study! Survey says! XXX!
I agree, you really shouldn't base your argument on the word of a pro-socialist organization.

States which don't allow people to carry concealed weapons or have strict concealed carry laws have experienced a bigger drop in violent crime. 
 "Between 1992 through 1998 (the last six years for which data exists), the violent crime rate in the strict and no-issue states fell 30% while the violent crime rate for states that liberalized carry laws prior to 1992 dropped half as much — by 15%. Nationally, the violent crime rate fell 25%."
 http://www.bradycampaign.org/facts/research/conctruth.asp

 
 What is your point? You explain the statistic very clearly, but what is your point?
 
 Do you imply guns cause crime?
 Do you prove guns cause crime?
 Do you prove guns increase crime?
 What are you trying to back up with that statistic?
 and how does it work?
 
 It is just a worthless statistic unless you give an analysis or extrapolate a logical conclusion from it. Please explain further.
 
 Remember root cause?
 
 Here is a statistic for you: more prisoners and felons come from broken families.
 
 Prisoners commit crime. Without the supervision from loving parents a criminal never learns to be a moral and ethical member of society as a child. Basically children from broken families do not learn right from wrong. Then become criminals. Help families stay together, help families raise good children, and you stop crime. Broken families are thus one of the root causes of crime. 
 
 There is one way you can stop crime and without taking away guns. Do you remember the others? Yes do all those and you stop crime without taking away guns.
 
 What are you trying to say? Take the guns? Guns cause crime?
